Perturbation-based Post-hoc Explanations for Image Attribution
  • post_hoc
  • ImageAUCEvaluator
  • View page source

ImageAUCEvaluator

class post_hoc.evaluation.ImageAUCEvaluator(mode='srg', perturber=None, return_curves=False, normalize=False, return_visuals=False)

Bases: object

Evaluates an image attribution through calculating the area under the deletion curve by deleting pixels/segments from most to least attributed (mif) or deleting the least attributed first (lif). Can also calculate both and return the difference between them (srg).

Parameters:

  • mode (str) – Which score to calculate. ‘mif’/’lif’ are included in ‘srg’

  • perturber (callable) – Perturber used to remove the segments

  • return_curves (bool) – Whether to also return the model outputs

  • normalize (bool) – Whether to normalize so the curve(s) goes from 1 to 0

  • return_visuals (bool) – Whether to also return the deletion images

Methods Summary

__call__(image, model, vals[, masks, ...])

param image:

[H,W,C] array of the image that has been attributed

get_normalized()

Methods Documentation

__call__(image, model, vals, masks=None, sample_size=None, model_idxs=Ellipsis)
Parameters:

  • image (array) – [H,W,C] array of the image that has been attributed

  • model (callable) – Model used to predict from batches of images

  • vals (array) – Array of attribution scores for each feature

  • masks (array) – [S,H,W] array of segment masks (None=vals per pixel)

  • sample_size (int) – How many perturbed images to generate

  • model_idxs (index) – Index for the model outputs to use

Returns ([array], ([array],optional)):

List of [O] arrays of AUC for O model outputs for each score List of [sample_size, O] arrays with all model outputs
